thread.title: Panthers claw past Eagles in game decided on final play
thread.title_full: Panthers claw past Eagles in game decided on final play

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Panthers claw past Eagles in game decided on final play
text:
Panthers claw past Eagles in game decided on final play Medomak, Ellsworth to play again Oct. 30 in Waldoboro By Staff | Oct 19, 2015 
Waldoboro — Talk about down to the wire. 
It was a back-and-forth affair on Saturday afternoon, Oct. 17 between Medomak Valley and Ellsworth/Sumner as the high school football teams, ineligible for postseason play, battled like squads vying for a playoff spot. 
The game came down to the final play, but the Eagles could not complete the late rally as the home-standing Panthers prowled to their fifth win — a 22-16 victory — in their first official varsity season. 
The squads were scoreless after the first quarter, while Ellsworth led 8-6 at halftime and held the same advantage after three quarters. 
The Panthers then outscored the Eagles 16-8 in the final quarter to prevail. 
Medomak Valley, a Class C school by enrollment, and Ellsworth/Sumner, a Class B school by enrollment, are ineligible for postseason play as both teams are playing down one and two classes, respectively, for the 2015 and 2016 seasons. 
On Saturday, Cole Ashmore had another banner day on the gridiron as he rushed for 203 yards on 35 carries, which finding the end zone three times for Medomak Valley. Owen Gilbert also had a 22-yard field goal for the hosts in the win. 
The game was exciting down to the final minutes as the Panthers held a 22-8 lead with just under a minute left when Ellsworth/Sumner's Wally Moon caught a 30-yard touchdown pass with 45 seconds left on the clock. 
After the two-point conversion, the Eagles trailed 22-16 and set up for the onside kick — which the visitors recovered. 
The game came down to one final play, but Panther Zach Rollins forced a fumble and fell on the ball as time expired to give the hosts the win. 
The teams will play a final game against one another on Saturday, Oct. 30 at 7 p.m in Waldoboro. 
Both teams will have played only seven regular-season games by season's end as both were scheduled to play Camden Hills, which canceled its season last month. 
Ellsworth, which has been credited with a Sept. 26 forfeit win over Camden Hills, is 4-3 and will end its regular season at home Friday, Oct. 23 against Dexter. 
Medomak Valley, officially set to play Camden Hills on Friday, Oct. 23, is 5-2, according to the Crabtree Point Standings, but will end the season 6-2 once that date passes and a forfeit win over the Windjammers is added. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Crabtree Point Standings for Class D North, Medomak Valley (5-2, 116.0429 points) is fourth, while Maine Central Institute (7-0, 148.2143 points) is first in the 12-team region. 
The top eight eligible teams will qualify for the playoffs. 
Medomak Valley has played a bundle of close, down-to-the-wire games, especially early in its first campaign.
